instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 Water Damage Backlight
threads.message:
I am with this 00165 with backlight issue

First I just found out the filter... replace and still no backlight..Replaced the backlight IC and I do still do not have backlight.


D7701
PIN1 = 8.56
PIN2 = 8.32


Where could I go?

threads.title: 820-00165 Water Damage Backlight
threads.message: Check XW7720 bridge integrity; lot of info available on the forum, including photos.

threads.title: 820-00165 Water Damage Backlight
threads.message: I think its okay. I even put a bit of solder on the Test Point itself.

threads.title: 820-00165 Water Damage Backlight
threads.message:
When you remove U7701 is very easy to check the continuity; should do that every time.

Post BKL_PWM level.
Try PRAM reset 2-3 times.

"found out the filter"
Filter being what?
